Name: Uniconazole
Description: (1E)-1-(4-chlorophenyl)-4,4-dimethyl-2-(1H-1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)pent-1-en-3-ol is a member of the class of triazoles that is 1,2,4-triazole which is substituted at position 1 by a 1-(p-chlorophenyl)-3-hydroxy-4,4-dimethylpent-1-en-2-yl group. It is a member of monochlorobenzenes, a secondary alcohol and a member of triazoles.

plant_translocations.content: One-year-old 'Golden Delicious' apple trees grafted onto MM 106 rootstocks were injected in the rootstock stem (shank) with 14C-uniconazole to determine the extent to which uniconazole is translocated and degraded over the length of an average growing season. In 4 months, 16% of recovered ~4C-activity was translocated to the new shoots. Most of the ~4C-activity remained in the rootstock. Chromatographic evaluation of shoot extracts demonstrated that the ~4C-activity associated with uniconazole decreased 49% in 4 months. However, shoot growth was still inhibited which suggests that the amount of uniconazole that was degraded did not interfere with the inhibition of gibberellin biosynthesis, probably due to the continuous translocation of uniconazole that occurred.
plant_translocations.reference: Sterrett, J. P. (1990). Translocation and degradation of injected uniconazole in apple during a 4-month growing period. Journal of Plant Growth Regulation, 9(1-4), 147–150. doi:10.1007/bf02041954

method.Apply Location: Rootstock, injected 5 cm above the root/stem transition zone
method.Plant Grown Condition: 25°C, 65 ± 10% relative humidity, 158 μmol s-1 m-2 photosynthetically active radiation (400-700 nm), 14-hour photoperiod
method.Chemical Preparation: 1.0 mg 14C-uniconazole (phenyl-ring labeled) in 0.5 ml methanol (specific activity, 74.6 mCi/mmol)
method.Pesticide Application Details for the Pl: Rootstock injected with 1.0 mg 14C-uniconazole.To insure inhibition, 1.5 months later a sec_x0002_ond dose of unlabeled uniconazole (1.0 mg) was injected into the rootstock 4 cm above and opposite the first injection site.
method.Other Information: Three trees per sample, three replications for immediate assay, four trees/time period (four replications) harvested and assayed for 14C-activity 2, 3, and 4 months after injection

plant_translocations.result: [{"Months after application": 2, "New Shoots (dpm/mg)": "33.6 +- 4.4", "New Shoots (% of total applied)": "9.8 +- 0.5"}, {"Months after application": 3, "New Shoots (dpm/mg)": "32.4 +- 5.3", "New Shoots (% of total applied)": "14.2 +- 2.8"}, {"Months after application": 4, "New Shoots (dpm/mg)": "33.2 +- 2.7", "New Shoots (% of total applied)": "16.2 +- 0.5"}]
